sailpoint.object

Class ActivityConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.ActivityConfig
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject

    public class ActivityConfig
extends AbstractXmlObject
    An object that describes activity monitoring configuration. There are two levels of enablement, a global "all ON" flag and enablement at the application level. One of these objects can be assigned to either the individual Identity or to a role.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getEnabledApplications

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getEnabledApplications()
        Returns a list of the currently enabled application ids.

      • setEnabledApplications

        public void setEnabledApplications(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> enabled)
        Set the list of the currently enabled application ids.

      • setAllEnabled

        public void setAllEnabled(boolean enableAll)
        Set the top level boolean to enable all applications. This will indicate to the activity aggregator when true to ignore the individual application assignments.

      • isAllEnabled

        public boolean isAllEnabled()
        Returns true if all applications activities should be stored.

      • enableAll

        public boolean enableAll()

      • addApplication

        public void addApplication(java.lang.String id)

      • removeApplication

        public void removeApplication(java.lang.String id)

      • clearApplications

        public void clearApplications()
        Convenience method to clear any enabled application ids.

      • disableApplication

        public void disableApplication(Application app)
        Remove a single application from the enabled list.

      • enableApplication

        public void enableApplication(Application app)
        Add a single application from the enabled list. This method only adds id's that do not already exist in the enabled list.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(java.lang.String id)
        Returns true if the given application id found in the configured list of enabled applications.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(Application application)
        Returns true if the given Application is enabled. Search using both the id and the name, the name seems to be required by some older unit tests.

      • enabled

        public boolean enabled(Application application)
        Old name, should use isEnabled instead. Returns true if the given application is found in the configured list of enabled applications. It also returns true if the enableAll flag is set to true.

      • enabled

        public boolean enabled()
        Returns true if there is one ore more applications enabled for this configuration. Also returns true if the enableAll flag indicates all application activities should be tracked.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)

        equals in class java.lang.Object
